name: synchronically
content:

in a way that relates to something, especially a language, at a particular point in time, without considering how it developed to that point: Synchronically, phonetic processes often reflect stylistic preferences. This process can be analyzed both synchronically and diachronically.
More examplesFewer examplesThese concepts should be considered diachronically and not just synchronically.The material in the book is arranged synchronically.Synchronically, we produce either a conventional or an unconventional utterance.Interpretations of lexical items are synchronically flexible - new uses may or may not become conventions.
